The plant has phyllodes, which are flattened leaf stalks that perform the function of leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid regions. Acacia colei plays an important role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
